net.epconsortium.cryptomarket.database.dao

Class Balance

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.epconsortium.cryptomarket.database.dao.Balance

  • public class Balance
extends Object
    Class used to represent the Balance of one coin
    Author:
    roinujnosde

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        public BigDecimal getValue()
        Returns the balance value
        Returns:
        the value

      • getPurchaseAverage

        public BigDecimal getPurchaseAverage()
        Returns the purchase average
        Returns:
        the average (totalPaid / totalPurchased)

      • setValue

        public void setValue(BigDecimal value)
              throws IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the value of the balance and maintains the average purchase returned by getPurchaseAverage()
        Parameters:
        value - the new value
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if value is less than 0
        NullPointerException - if value is null

      • decrease

        public void decrease(BigDecimal sold,
                     BigDecimal received)
              throws IllegalArgumentException
        Decreases the balance value
        Parameters:
        sold - cryptocoin sold amount
        received - amount received in server coin
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if sold is bigger than getValue(); if sold or received are less or equal to 0

      • increase

        public void increase(BigDecimal purchased,
                     BigDecimal paid)
              throws IllegalArgumentException
        Increases the balance value
        Parameters:
        purchased - cryptocoin purchased amount
        paid - amount paid in server coin
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if purchased or paid are not positive

      • getProfitPercentage

        public BigDecimal getProfitPercentage(BigDecimal exchangeRate)
        Returns the profit percentage if the investor sells his balance at this exchange rate. This can return a negative value meaning a loss.
        Parameters:
        exchangeRate - the exchange rate
        Returns:
        the percentage (100 = 100%)
